verses.verse: For all this I considered <S%H5414><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> even to declare <S%H952><s%> all this <S%H6662><s%>, that the righteous, and the wise <S%H2450><s%>, and their works <S%H5652><s%>, are in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>: no man <S%H120><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> either <S%H1571><s%> love <S%H160><s%> or hatred <S%H8135><s%> by all that is before them <S%H6440><s%>.

All things come alike to all <S%H259><s%>: there is one event <S%H4745><s%> to the righteous <S%H6662><s%>, and to the wicked <S%H7563><s%>; to the good <S%H2896><s%> and to the clean <S%H2889><s%>, and to the unclean <S%H2931><s%>; to him that sacrifices <S%H2076><s%>, and to him that <S%H834><s%> sacrifices <S%H2076><s%> not <S%H2896><s%>: as is the good, so is the sinner <S%H2398><s%>; and he that swears <S%H7650><s%>, as he that fears <S%H3373><s%> a oath <S%H7621><s%>.

This is a evil <S%H7451><s%> among all things that are done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, that there is one <S%H259><s%> event <S%H4745><s%> unto all <S%H3820><s%>: Yes, also the heart of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> is full <S%H4390><s%> of evil <S%H7451><s%>, and madness <S%H1947><s%> is in their heart <S%H3824><s%> while they live <S%H2416><s%>, and after <S%H310><s%> that they go to the dead <S%H4191><s%>.

For <S%H4310><s%> to him that is <S%H3426><s%> joined <S%H2266><s%> to all the living <S%H2416><s%> there is hope <S%H986><s%>: for a living <S%H2416><s%> dog <S%H3611><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than a dead <S%H4191><s%> lion <S%H738><s%>.

For the living <S%H2416><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> that they shall die <S%H4191><s%>: but the dead <S%H4191><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> not any thing <S%H3972><s%>, neither have they any more a reward <S%H7939><s%>; for the memory <S%H2143><s%> of them is forgotten <S%H7911><s%>.

Also their love <S%H160><s%>, and their hatred <S%H8135><s%>, and their envy <S%H7068><s%>, is now <S%H3528><s%> perished <S%H6><s%>; neither have they any more a portion <S%H2506><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%> in any thing that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

Go your way <S%H3212><s%>, eat <S%H398><s%> your bread <S%H3899><s%> with joy <S%H8057><s%>, and drink <S%H8354><s%> your wine <S%H3196><s%> with a merry <S%H2896><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>; for God <S%H430><s%> now <S%H3528><s%> accepts <S%H7521><s%> your works <S%H4639><s%>.
Let your garments <S%H899><s%> be always <S%H6256><s%> white <S%H3836><s%>; and let your head <S%H7218><s%> lack <S%H2637><s%> no ointment <S%H8081><s%>.

Live <S%H2416><s%> joyfully <S%H7200><s%> with the wife <S%H802><s%> whom you love <S%H157><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of the life <S%H2416><s%> of your vanity <S%H1892><s%>, which he has given <S%H5414><s%> you under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, all the days <S%H3117><s%> of your vanity <S%H1892><s%>: for that is your portion <S%H2506><s%> in this life <S%H2416><s%>, and in your labor <S%H5999><s%> which you take <S%H6001><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

Whatever your hand <S%H3027><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%>, do <S%H6213><s%> it with your might <S%H3581><s%>; for there is no work <S%H4639><s%>, nor device <S%H2808><s%>, nor knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, nor wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, in the grave <S%H7585><s%>, where you go <S%H1980><s%>.

I returned <S%H7725><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, that the race <S%H4793><s%> is not to the swift <S%H7031><s%>, nor the battle <S%H4421><s%> to the strong <S%H1368><s%>, neither yet bread <S%H3899><s%> to the wise <S%H2450><s%>, nor yet riches <S%H6239><s%> to men of understanding <S%H995><s%>, nor yet favor <S%H2580><s%> to men of skill <S%H3045><s%>; but time <S%H6256><s%> and chance <S%H6294><s%> happens to them all <S%H7136><s%>.

For man <S%H120><s%> also knows <S%H3045><s%> not his time <S%H6256><s%>: as the fish <S%H1709><s%> that are taken <S%H270><s%> in a evil <S%H7451><s%> net <S%H4685><s%>, and as the birds <S%H6833><s%> that are caught <S%H270><s%> in the snare <S%H6341><s%>; so <S%H1992><s%> are the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> snared <S%H3369><s%> in a evil <S%H7451><s%> time <S%H6256><s%>, when it falls <S%H5307><s%> suddenly upon them <S%H6597><s%>.
This <S%H2090><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> have I seen <S%H7200><s%> also under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, and it seemed great unto me <S%H1419><s%>:

There was a little <S%H6996><s%> city <S%H5892><s%>, and few <S%H4592><s%> men <S%H582><s%> inside it <S%H935><s%>; and there came a great <S%H1419><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> against it <S%H5437><s%>, and besieged it <S%H1129><s%>, and built great <S%H1419><s%> bulwarks against it <S%H4685><s%>:

Now there was found <S%H4672><s%> in it a poor <S%H4542><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H376><s%>, and he by his wisdom <S%H2451><s%> delivered <S%H4422><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%>; yet no man <S%H120><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> that same poor <S%H4542><s%> man <S%H376><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> I <S%H2451><s%>, Wisdom is better <S%H2896><s%> than strength <S%H1369><s%>: nevertheless the poor man <S%H4542><s%>'s wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is despised <S%H959><s%>, and his words <S%H1697><s%> are not heard <S%H8085><s%>.
The words <S%H1697><s%> of wise <S%H2450><s%> men are heard <S%H8085><s%> in quiet <S%H5183><s%> more than the cry <S%H2201><s%> of him that rules <S%H4910><s%> among fools <S%H3684><s%>.
Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than weapons <S%H3627><s%> of war <S%H7128><s%>: but one <S%H259><s%> sinner <S%H2398><s%> destroys <S%H6><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>.
